bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 187 (Thursday, November 21, 2019)][House][Pages H9169-H9170]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. BEATTY:H.R. 5223.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H9170]]Article I, Section 8, Clause 3

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Generating Resources and Opportunities Within Affordable Housing Act or the GROW Affordable Housing Act

This bill increases the amount of funds the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac) and the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) must allocate each year to the Housing Trust Fund and the Capital Magnet Fund, both of which support affordable housing and are administered by the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

bill.title: GROW Affordable Housing Act

item.title: To amend the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992 to adjust the affordable housing allocations.
Generating Resources and Opportunities Within Affordable Housing Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
